intro: Uralepis brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian urare, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
